articles.title: Majority jury verdicts: common sense or bad justice? - Stuff.co.nz
articles.description: As America insists on unanimous jury verdicts, New Zealand persists with a system some say is unsafe.
articles.content: As America moves to allow only unanimous jury verdicts, questions are being asked why New Zealand continues to permit majority decisions. Mike White investigates whether majority verdicts have improv… [+15851 chars]

articles.author: Yeganeh Torbati, Andrew Van Dam, Alyssa Fowers
articles.title: Unemployment benefits expire for 7 million Americans, pressuring families and the economy - The Washington Post
articles.description: Federal funds meant to ease the economic shock of the pandemic are coming to an end. “It just feels like being discarded,” one worker said.
